Reviews.Title: “Average !”
Reviews.Author: Knario30
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very helpfull receptionist giving direction. I missed breakfast, so can't say anything !! However, make sure you lock your room from inside, you might found housekeeping getting into the room without nocking !!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Revisited”
Reviews.Author: russel1lHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from another wonderful visit to Paris...and are ready to return. The Hotel des Nations St. Germain is a very unique French hotel. All the staff members made us feel "right at home". They were always well informed and knowledgeable in getting us to where we wanted to go. The rooms were small, however, they were meticulously clean and well maintained. It is located near two metro stations with access to all of Paris. The ambiance of being a part of the "heart beat" of Paris was like none other. The local grocery store down to the left of the hotel became our stopping off point for wonderful French wines, freshly baked breads & pastries, and cheese. To the right of the hotel and a block or two over was the heart of the village with shops, brasseries, music, crepes, and lively entertainment. Our adult family of 6 had a most memorable trip....and will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Chrissie Barnsley”
Reviews.Author: Geosam
Reviews.Content: My sister and I are two ladies of 60ish. We shared a twin room, which although small, provided us with all we needed. The beds were comfortable, the room was nicely furnished and everythign was spotless. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. on our final day we decided to have breakfast in the hotel and wished we had done so on the other mornings as it was plentiful and very good value. Location was excellent being close to Notre Dame, restaurants and very easy to get to from the Gard Du Nord and Gard d;est Stations. We stayed three nights and I have nothing negative to say. I would recommend it to anyone .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craig D
Reviews.Content: As other reviews say, this is a small hotel, but an excellent location, we could see Notre Dame out of our window. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful, especially Julien and Valerie, who went above and beyond to sort out any problems we had. The Metro station Place Monge is just round the corner, but you're within walking distance of the Seine anyway. The room itself was very clean and well stocked with tea and coffee making facilities. I'd like to go back to Paris soon, and this will be the first place I try and book in.

Reviews.Title: “a week in paris...”
Reviews.Author: ferdinand g
Reviews.Content: the hotel room was small but considering were in paris where space is expensive it was ok for us though.the staff were very pleasant and conversant specially in english.julien,jerome and arthur at reception desk are very welcoming when we arrived at the hotel,lina the housekeeping staff was very good at her work in maintaining the room clean and tidy.the hotel was very convinient as well as it sits between two metro station and a 5minute walk to notredame as well and local grocery stores nearby.and lastly,the room was very quiet as well specially at night when you really want to have a good night.we will absolutely comeback in this hotel and would like to recommend it to others... Ferdie and Hazel Gallo...

Reviews.Title: “One night in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: Reception was efficient and welcoming...except for some inaccurate information about breakfast options - there is only one option @ 14 euros per person! Room was on the small side - but very clean. Staff were pleasant and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Bit pricey for what you get...”
Reviews.Author: pinkypic20
Reviews.Content: ...but overall its clean and the service was great so there are no negative points to mention.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelbug144
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a flight booking of a certain 'budget airline'. Fabulous location in-between 2 Metro stations a minutes walk. Rooms are small but so is everywhere in Paris. Great breakfast included in price. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly so all in all a successful and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: ozFinn
Reviews.Content: There is nothing terribly fancy or fantastic about the des Nations, barring the wonderful reception staff member Julien, who is deserving of all the praise he has received on these pages. My room was a little frayed around the edges, but was not dirty and was kept that way throughout my stay. The lift is small, but I am led to believe that this is very common in hotels in Paris, I mostly made use of the stairs as I was only on the third floor. There are two metro stations close by for travelling to other parts of Paris. It is a 10minute walk down to the Seine & Notre Dame. I went for a longer walk to the Musee D'orsay which took less than an hour and was very nice walking along the river. There are many restaurants nearby, as well as bakeries and a small Carrefour supermarket. For the sci-fi geeks, heading down towards Notre Dame there is a sci-fi shop that seems to keep irregular trading hours, but has lots of good things to browse and buy!

Reviews.Title: “No more than 2 people in the elevator”
Reviews.Author: jmjabbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our 3 nights in Paris which was booked through Air Canada Vacations. All I can say is that this hotel should not be on included in hotels that are offered from Air Canada Vacations, agents seem to push this hotel on you. The one mentionable positive part of our stay was the conceirge, Julien who was very pleasant. From the elevators that do not hold more than 2 people and can't decide if it it's going to stop on floor 1 or 2 is a joke. The rooms are not just small, but almost the size of the safe that is in the closet, by the way there is no point in having a safe in the room unless you want to pull a muscle getting into it. Oh yes, there is a closet, but you need to be on the otherside of the bed inorder to hang something. The bathrooms were an adequate size, except I had to house a piece of luggage in there. Yes this is a eco friendly hotel, everytime we got off the elevator we had to turn on the light which had a timer so you better have your key ready for the door. The location of this hotel was good it is located in the Latin Quarter which is truly a place to see. I would suggest re-rating this hotel to meet today's standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Things Come In Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: Samantha F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of November based on previous reviews and found it to be excellent value for money. The reception staff were very polite and helpful at check in and spoke to us in English, which was a relief, as we only speak basic French. We were checked into a first floor street-facing room, right next to the lift and even though the windows kept the street noise out, the lift noise did not make for a good night's sleep. When I spoke to reception the next morning re: switching rooms, they advised of other available double rooms we could have and we took up the offer of a ground floor room in the courtyard, which was much quieter and did us fine for the rest of our stay. The rooms are small, but they have adequate en-suites, fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The drawers did need a wipe clean before we unpacked into them, but on the plus side, the beds are very comfortable and you get a great night's sleep. We did not take breakfast at the hotel, as there are so many good bakeries nearby. It is a good base in an area of Paris that felt safe walking around at night - mostly student area. Rue Mouffetard is just behind the hotel (turn right going out the hotel and right again up Rue Rollin) and has fabulous places to eat and drink. If you ask for a glass of white wine you are offered Chablis / similar good quality for only 4 euros. There are many good quality, traditional restaurants that offer excellent quality 3-course lunches/dinners for around 10 euros. The best ones we tried were Bistro Garamond, which had a nice bar across the street for pre-dinner cocktails for 5 euros and Le Mouff'tot Moufftard. Further down Rue Mouffetard is an asian cafe called Comestibles where you get a starter, a main and a soft drink for 6.5 euros. This was a perfect place for lunch, spotlessly clean and some of the nicest Chinese food we'd had in a while. On our first visit to Paris we used the metro to get around and this time we used the red open top bus (Les Cars Rouges). Thankfully we did not book the ticket in advance as our flight was delayed, so just bought the ticket on the bus the next day. The nearest stop for this service is a 5 minute walk at the far side of Notre Dame and a 1-day ticket lasts 2. This is the best way to get your bearings and you can get dropped off/picked up at a number of stops near the main attractions. The Louvre is free entry on the first Sunday of the month, but Napoleon's tomb is closed on the first Monday of the month. If you are coming from CDG airport by RER train, the hotel advises changing to metro line 7 at gare du nord. We found this quite stressful as it was extremely crowded, so on the way back to the airport, opted to take the RER from Jardin Du Luxembourg. It's only 9 euros for the ticket which is good on the metro and RER, so recommend this, but check the RER stops at Jardin Du Luxembourg as some are express services. When you get off at Jardin Luxembourg, the hotel is 5-10 min. walk - take exit 1- Place Edmond Rostand, cross the road and take 2nd street on right - Rue Soufflot towards the Panthenon at the top and the hotel is just a couple of streets behind the Panthenon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst places I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Creng
Reviews.Content: At first glance the hotel seemed close for refurbishment: no visible lights from outside. The room was so small I couldn't enter with the bag on the shoulder. The carpet looked very dirty, and the toilette was smaller than my closet. I would recommend to avoid it. The breakfast must be avoided: 20€ for junkie food in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: grazzauk1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located. Within walking distance from Notre Dame 20mins Louvre 30mins. Paris is very easy and nice to walk around. There are lots of Bars and Restaurants near the hotel. The room was small but very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't have the breakfast at 14 euros. We decided to eat out. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: macfun
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for touring Paris. You are between 2 metro stops - Cardinal Lemoine and Place Monge. There are some interesting eateries nearby on Mufftard. I enjoyed walking to Notre Dame across the Pont de Tournelle. Interestingly, near that bridge is an expensive restaurant, La Tour de A'rgent! (too pricey for me) I was with a small group staying at this hotel. We had twin beds. The rooms are small, but the bath was sufficient. (That's where we stored our luggage). The hotel personnel are very friendly and helpful and speak English. Breakfast was included in our price. It did not change during our week stay - scrambled eggs, limpy bacon, sausage, packaged cheese, croissants/bread, cut fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea. It was ok and convenient. There is a bakery down the street. You can sit in the dining area anytime of the day. I did not bring any techie toys with me, but I did note that the wifi is NOT free. There is a computer in the lobby with a 8euro for a half hour charge. Our room was cleaned and straightened everyday. If one had a problem, just let the front desk know and they took care of it immediately. If you are not use to European hotels, it may surprise you at how small the rooms and hallway are. I was, but others in my group said this was pretty standard. We had a inside room (#41) and were not bothered too much by noise from outside. Most noise issues were with hotel occupants talking in the narrow hall or walking heavy. The beds are very firm. I like the quality of the sheets. Washcloths are not supplied (again typical of European hotels.) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfy, like a good pair of slippers!”
Reviews.Author: shona60
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting a posh modern sterile hotel, this is not it. This is a smaller, older hotel with a bit of character, a little worn around the edges maybe, but gives great service and is clean and tidy. Most important was the comfy bed, we could control the air conditioning to suit us in our room and the mini bar had several types of non-alcoholic drink choices as well (Tobberone chocolate and Pringle chips too:) The bathroom had a hairdryer and despite what a previous review had led us to believe the shower did have a shower door. While our room did not have a view that was not important to us as we were only their to sleep. The rooms are an adequate size and there is a lounge downstairs by reception which also provides newspapers - we appreciated the one in English. Unfortunately we could not access our e.mails from the computer - not sure why - and it did not have a qwerty keyboard. Not a big deal to us when on holiday and it could have been our lack of computer skills. The buffet breakfast was fantastic with so many choices and catered for different nationalities as well. I don't drink tea or coffee so was most appreciative of the hot milk and pkt chocolate powder for my morning cuppa - most impressed with the whole breakfast experience. The location was great! We could walk directly down our street and the one following on and get to Notre Dame in about a 15 minutes stroll. Along the way was a small supermarket that we could pick up pre-packaged sandwiches,salads, fruit, drink etc. at reasonable prices to put in our backpack for lunch. Up the road was a good market (I bought a couple of really nice skirts) and all around were shops and a huge variety of restaurants all in a basic suburban like area. The Metro underground was only a couple of minutes up the road from the hotel for those more confident than us - very close by. August was a good time to be in Paris this year. We struck warm weather - mid 20's - just right for strolling around in summer clothes and not too hot or humid except one day that got to the 30's. We were only there for three nights so we got a two day pass for the L'Tour hop-on, hop-off bus and boat tour as it was the only company that offered the combined pass. It was good value and one of the pick-up points for the bus was only a couple of short blocks from the hotel in St Germain Boulevard. The nearest boat pick-up was at our side of Notre Dame so both easily accessed. I hadn't been to Paris before and this way I got to see a lot in a short time. Most enjoyable too. I had bought a small Lonely Planet language guide before I went and had tried to learn some of the phrases and signs e.g. Sortie meant Exit. The locals seemed to appreciate the gesture of trying to use their language but most places people spoke English and understood us and some of the menu's had English subtitles.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a bit cramped in our twin room”
Reviews.Author: Mareli1922
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for our sightseeing and for that reason we are glad we chose it but the twin room was tiny with hardly any space around the bed. Facilities ok though and reception staff very helpful. We didn't have breakfast as we felt it was too expensive (14 euro) for continental breakfast so we ate out nearby for just 6 euro.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: Chunkylover53__x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at the end of August on some deal with eurostar which included travel, room and trip on the Seine. Very good value this way, much lower than the published price at the hotel which isn't good value. Rooms are small, clean and functional. Lots of hot water. The front desk staff friendly and helpful. Nothing special about this place, don't stay here if you are wanting to spend any time in the hotel. As a base it's got a good location very close to two Metro lines and some of the tourist sites in relatively easy walking; main ones being Notre Dame, Louvre and the associated parks. The latin quater offers much cheaper options for eating in resturants that don't all have multilanguage menus ready for you or feel contrived. Head out of the hotel (right out of the hotel, and right again and head up) to the mouffetard area for a good collection of restaurants and bars that pretty much cover everything you could want for eating and drinking. Head elsewhere for fine dining though. Definitely recommend going to eat at the restaurant at the top left of Rue Rollin (unfortunately I didn't get the name and what's there on google street map is out of date). Checked red table cloths and very typically french (parisian) food at good prices - the other diners appeared to be locals. Can't comment on the breakfast in the hotel as we didn't take that option. Personally, I wouldn't bother. There's plenty of places close offering croissant and cafe for about 3 euro's or even full breakfast menu's for less than the hotel. Or better still just grab something out while appreciating a view somewhere. Only thing I would avoid is any room on the first floor, especially room 14. There's quite a bit of noise from the ground floor (breakfast noise etc) and most annoying is the electic motor for the hotel's front door which automatically opens any time anyone gets close to the door and seems to go into overdrive with people coming and going from about 6am-9am.

Reviews.Title: “Great place away - close enough but away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: RosLondon
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a friend's 50th birthday and wanted a small hotel away from the main crowds. This hotel was ideal for that. Yes, the rooms are small but they always are in Paris. Everything else was great for a weekend away although the small room would have been a major problem if we had more luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff, only let down by poor breakfast :-(”
Reviews.Author: andreaphilbin
Reviews.Content: visited for my birthday and was very pleasantly surprised having read many commnets about room size. With Paris and so many other locations literally on the doorstep, do you really need a massive room just to sleep in??? we found it adequate but Paris hotel rooms are generally small I gather. couple of negatives: phone charges billed from room were astronomical !!! 2 euro for 1 minute! will try to figure out the public phonebox card system next time. also breakfast was really poor. advertised as 'full english' ....it was nothing like an english breakfast. cold over-cooked scrambled eggs (which are not replenished by the miserable kitchen woman, even when asked.....went without!) , greasy, salty (cold) scraps of streaky bacon and little spicy (cold) sausage like things. at 15 euro, it really was a disgrace, condsidering you can get an amazing 3 course dinner round the corner for 13! there is other stuff available, continental style breakfast items, but even that was limited and the breakfast area is so small, you have to wait to be seated. i am amazed anyone rates the breakfast highly....depends what you are used to i suppose. as far from an 'english breakfast' as i have ever had! lots of positives, however!!! Room and bathroom were clean and everything worked as it should. the shower cubicle was a little on the small size, but that's nit-picking really. we were on the 6th floor with 3 balconies overlooking rue monge and with views of notre dame and sacre couer. plenty of local shops / cafes / restaurants and a very reasonable supermarket (Carrefour) within 5 mins walk (shop here for your bottled water etc as its VERY expensive in cafes and tourist areas). Would NOT reccomend eating in the St Severin area (I belive the locals refer to it as 'bacteria alley'!! but we had a fantastic meal at Le Bistrot Gourmand which is very near on Rue Mouffetard. fantastic location near to 2 metro stops and its also easy to access close on foot and further afield (eg Versailles) by the RER trains. Reception staff were lovely, esp. Julien who could not be more pleasant and helpful if he tried. we had a mini bar and whilst we didn't use anything from it (prices as always are high for mini bar), it came in really handy for storing our own drinks. tea and coffee making facilities in the room and tv with many international news / entertainment programs. beds are a little tired but comfy nonetheless. balcony windows are really well soundproofed. its quite near to the fire station so you do get the odd siren but you don't notice once the windows are shut. adequate bedding and pillows and there is an iron available on request. i must admit, i had misgivings about the french (not having visited before) but the reception staff at des nations quelled those for me. all were lovely and speak really good english! try to catch the sunday morning market at place rue monge and make use of the free museum entry (inc Louvre) on 1st sunday of each month would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, staff, and breakfast but a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Cam087
Reviews.Content: For the price we found our room a little small and a bit dingy, but the service was nice, the breakfast was above average, and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reliable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jess125483
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during the first week of July. Upon entering our room, we were a little shocked by just how small our room was. I had flashbacks to National Lampoon's European Vacation. However, I know that most European hotels are like this so I didn't let the fact that I am used to more space skew my opinion. I must say that all of the staff in the hotel - from the reception people to the cleaning people - were very friendly. The reception staff all spoke english very well and were very helpful. The cleaning people were very reliable - they came every day and the room was always clean and our towels were changed, etc. Even the prices of things in the mini bar were not bad by hotel standards (more than you would pay in a grocery store, but a lot less than you'd pay in other hotels). There was no restaurant or room service, but there was a breakfast included, which was good as well. The location of this hotel is fantastic - one subway line literally across the street (though kind of hidden, we only learned where it was a few days in) and another just a block or two up the street. The metro lines go basically everywhere you could want them to, even if sometimes a transfer was required. We never had to take a cab anywhere. The cafes in the area are very nice and there are also several bakeries. The hotel is walking distance from Notre Dame and the bustling area of St. Germain. I'd say that as long as you are fine with a "no frills" type of room, you will be extremely happy with the location and excellent service. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: elaines4
Reviews.Content: The location was close to the Metro and within walking distance of many other attractions. Our room was comfortable and roomy. The Staff were excellent; very friendly and helpful. Offered service which one would not normally expect.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: rjf2
Reviews.Content: I suspect that there are several hundred hotels in Paris. Many of these are “for” those persons for whom money is no concern. If you are such a person do not read on. If, however, you are someone for whom price is relevant then I have a hotel for you! The Hotel Des Nations Saint Germain is a perfect “home base” for travelers in Paris. First, it is on the low end of expense—really, the very low end. Second, it is located on the left bank in the wonderful Latin Quarter. A block-walk places one in the very heart of this cultural scene-scape of Parisian life. The Metro is “up the street” (and down the street). The Parthenon and the Jardins du Luxembourg are right over the hill behind the hotel. It is a quiet spot on the edge of the “university crowd”. The Jardins des Plantes is just down the hill in the opposite direction. The Seine is a few blocks across the delightful Rue Saint- Germain. Third, the rooms—very “French” in terms of modest size—are warmly cared for, many with terraces that look out across to the Cathedral Notre-Dame and, on the clear day, the Basilique. Newly renovated bathrooms enhance one’s stay. But, best, of all is the incredibly warm, friendly and flawlessly helpful staff—and, of course, double this if you don’t speak French (well). They simply “make it happen” (including the loan of an umbrella on an inclement day). If you are, like we were, in need of some confidence in choosing a hotel from among the hundreds listed on various web sites, take me seriously. This is a little gem. Bon voyage! And say “hello” to Julien and this colleagues when you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank Hotel with Superior Manager”
Reviews.Author: bluebird1000
Reviews.Content: We booked Des Nations Saint Germain through go-today.com to use as our base while we attended the French Open this month. The thing that really stands out is the wonderful manager, Valerie, who greeted us when we arrived and was extremely helpful throughout the stay. She helped me print tickets, mail postcards, and answered any questions we had. The rooms are tiny, which is expected in a 3 star Paris hotel, but they are clean and the bathrooms are good sized and ours was updated. We asked for an off-street room and were easily accommodated. There is a safety concern with the bathtubs as there were no mats or grab bars and the European tubs have high sides so it's risky getting in and out. And if you are a plus size person you'll have trouble taking a bath here as these tubs are deep and narrow. Even though the rooms are tiny in size, there is a closet and drawer space that allows you to unpack and stow everything, although there's not really a way to stow two suitcases and two carryons easily. The air conditioning was working fine and quickly cooled our room when we needed it. The beds & pillows were comfortable and we both slept like a rock. The breakfast was fairly typical, croissants, toast, scrambled eggs, sausage and (undercooked) bacon, plus cereal, yogurt, cheese and beverages. The location is easy walking distance to two separate Metro stations and you're just a short downhill stroll to Blvd. St. Germain with all its attractions. I would recommend this hotel for any tourist who wants to stay on the Left Bank and have easy access to what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “OUR FOURTH STAY AT DES NATIONS”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time at Des Nations, situated in the the most perfect location - I cannot think of an area in Paris I would prefer to stay in. Our room was situated on the top (6th) floor, was small - but to be expected - bathroom was spotlessly clean. Staff on reception were polite and smiling and the breakfasts were as good as ever, although we did have to wait for thirty minutes for a table on the first morning as a group of around a dozen people spent a good hour sitting at their tables after they'd finished their breakfast. A wonderful trip again and we'll be back next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamJam_11 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was good value for money and situated in an ideal spot. It was quiet in the evening, very little traffic noise. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. The man on reception was excellent. He made us feel very welcome and gave us some info on the area and how to get around. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: OffroadAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on trip advisor and spent a week at the hotel while exploring Paris. The staff were fantastic, spoke english and gave great advise about where to go, which train lines to take, etc. The breakfasts were good, hot and cold buffet and excellent coffee. Our room was on the top floor looking down on Rua Monge. There was not much noise and I don't think we noticed traffic noise at all. The hotel is very central, 1km from the Notre Dame and 2 minutes walk to the Metro, Shops and restaurants abound in the area. General comment on Paris everything is very affordable except drinks and coffee shops but purchasing bottled water and refreshments at the local Supermarket (5 minutes from the hotel) was cheaper than at home in Cape Town. Would I go back - definitely and would I choose Des Nations Saint Germain? without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Livingincolor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Regetel Des Nations last May and found it to be very comfortable and pleasant. The rooms are on the small side, but decent and the hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. On our arrival we were given a very small room and when I asked if we could be moved to a larger room, the front desk manager upgraded us immediately. The surrounding streets are filled with great patisseries and cafes so there is no need to have the hotel breakfast -- it is on the expensive side. The hotel's location is very close to the Metro and a quick walk to the Place Contrescarpe via the Rue Cardinal Lemoine -- right past the flats where James Joyce and Hemingway once lived. There is a nice flea market just down the street by the Metro. There are very good grocery stores and pharmacies close by. It is a neighborhood and yet a great point of access to the city. Again, the staff are very kind and courteous. They understand the meaning of the word hospitality. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, serves basic purposes well”
Reviews.Author: Shanker419
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the middle of November 2010 for a week and enjoyed my stay very much. The main drawing point of the hotel is the location, which was fabulous. You are within walking distance to a lot of things and of course, b/c it is Paris, the Metro is not far. The room was bare minimum which was fine with me as I wasn't planning on being in it but to sleep and shower. As a solo traveler I got a real double bed which was a nice surprise, as these are rare in Europe. I will say, and this is not to be mean but rather informative, if I had been overweight I do not know how I would have showered. It was a VERY small shower, I had barely room to turn around. The front desk staff was very friendly. The internet seemed expensive (8 euro for 30 mins) but I really have no complaints. I would definitely stay again and hope I do when I get back to Paris ASAP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: hroe1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of a tour in Turkey and what a huge difference in service!! I visited Paris last year and wanted to do 3 days there just to see the sites I missed then. Let me just say this: 1) the room was incredibly small, even by Paris standards. 2) the hallway was very narrow (housekeeping supplies lining them) and hard to find the card slot for the lights because it was so dark. 3) bathroom was old and small, shower must've been made for a child, it was so small. 4) the room looked clean, but there was something dirty about it..I couldn't put my finger on it. 5) furniture in my room was old and the drapes were worn.The only thing good about this hotel was the breakfast and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay...”
Reviews.Author: Nutellafan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here September 2009. The hotel's location is great, a block from the metro. The hotel itself is just ok. Don't expect much. Rooms are tiny and they only have full size beds. They have no shower curtians which is a bit odd but you get used to it. The blankets were the only thing that really bothered me. There were hairs on it which was pretty gross. Breakfast service is great and the front desk attendant was always helpful and friendly. Overall, we believe we could have stayed at a better three star hotel for the same price, but all this didn't effect our amazing trip to beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “this is a great location/deal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blindbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days and had a great experience ..the location was fantastique the breakfast very good ..this hotel is steps to 2 metro station .... minutes to Rue moffertard where you find great food and stores...( try Chez nico crepes :-) the front desk staff was awesome ....specililly Julien he was very nice & helphful gav eeasy direction to everywhere I wanted to go the only thing..is that the rooms are a little small which I did not care beacuse I was out and about most of the time ..only wanted a clean safe place to stay and the great location was the best... I recoomend this hotel higly!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HowardTraveller
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, this is expected when visiting Paris, they are well presented, clean and the bathroom is a decent size. The bed was comfortable although I would have preferred a double bed rather than two singles. The staff were extremely helpful especially the Manager. The breakfast selection was really quite good and the coffee was supurb. The location of the hotel is excellent with two Metro lines within 140 metres to get you to most places. It is walking distance to a number of attractions is there are so many restaurants within walking distance. We were there for ten nights and appreciated the laundramat across the road and a supermarket just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Norwaycouple66-67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights during christmas 2007. Not the cheapest 3 star hotel in Paris, but this is an expencive area. You can easily reach here from any raylway stationby Metro. Take line 10 to Cardinal Lemoine or line 7 to Place Monge. Just be prepared to lift your suitcases in the narrow metro gates. The hotel itself was just OK. Small rooms, like many Paris hotels, but clean. The staff was very nice. The area is just perfect. Quiet, but with many shops, markets and resturants nearby. The neighbour street, Rue Mouffetard, known from the movie "The fabulous Amelie from Montemarte", is our favourite street in the entire Paris, with shops, market, resturants, boulangeries and creperies. You can have almost everything you need there. A messe or a visit in the local church, Saint Medard, is also to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Hit or Miss Rooms”
Reviews.Author: philahistory
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Latin Qtr, with a reasonably friendly staff. Rooms were small, but that seems to be typical of Paris. Air conditioning is spotty - some rooms cool off while others don't. With temps in the mid 90s during my stay, air conditioning was important for me. I changed rooms three times until I found a room that cooled off. For the price they charge, this really needs to be addressed. But the hotel is an easy walk to Notre Dame, and just a block from the bustling Mouffetard. The Cardinal Lemoine Metro stop was close, and plenty of great boulangeries nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: TMV0620
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip. The staff was friendly and more than helpful and put up with our maiming of the French language with good humor and lots of help. yes the rooms are small since the hotel is small but that is what gives it the European intimacy that we look for in our travels to Europe. It is walking distance to Notre Dame, one-half block from the Metro Stop and two short blocks from a host of cafes and plazas. We can't give enough praise to the staff whom we engaged in several conversations regarding both our travel and other interesting discussions. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “If you drop the soap in the shower, you'll be washing yourself with shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: scottie138
Reviews.Content: This hotel was too cramped for us. The rooms were so tiny that you could trip over the bed as you entered the room. The shower was incredibly small. The staff were nice and very helpful and the hotel is within walking distance to Notre Dame etc. There was no nightlife of any kind around. I found the neighborhood to be old and dirty. I wouldn't return to this hotel. I would cough up a few more dollars and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “GETS BETTER EACH YEAR!”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: Despite vowing not to return to Paris for financial reasons until the Pound improved against the Euro, we simply couldn't resist our annual trip to this wonderful city and again selected the Regetel Des Nations. This is now our third stay and on each occasion we have enjoyed the hotel a little bit more than the previous time. We made our booking through Hotels.com a month in advance, and sent a brief email directly to the hotel a few days prior to our visit requesting a room on one of the upper floors. This was immediately confirmed by return email. Our room (634) on the sixth and top floor overlooked the Rue Monge. The bathroom and bedroom was absolutely spotless. The bath had a shower screen which had not been present on previous occasions and I think may have been a recent addition unless we had just been unlucky before. The double bed was comfortable, but I would have preferred another pillow. I'm sure if I'd asked for one it would have been provided, but at the end of the day I was so exhausted I slept soundly. A buffet breakfast was included in our rate. The breakfast room is only small and seats approx 24 people, however by arriving at 8:30 we found it quiet and always managed to find a table. The breakfast consisted of fresh fruit salad, yoghurts and cereals, steaming hot scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cold ham, cheese, with plenty of delicious croissants, pain au chocolat and rolls. The breakfast certainly set us up for the whole day. The beauty of the location of the Hotel Des Nations is its close proximity to the Rue de Mouffetard, Place de Contrescarpe and the Pantheon area. I cannot think of any other area of Paris that I would prefer to stay in. Our sightseeing this year included the unmissable Montmartre area, Pigalle, the Marais, the Bastille area and the un-touristy Belleville area. Our thanks again to the Hotel Des Nations for making our annual trip to Paris one of the highlights of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: 20-something-vaca
Reviews.Content: Nice, little, no frills hotel. Small room (to be expected in Paris) and a nice size bathroom. The hotel was clean and well kept. The front desk staff were helpful with arranging travel to the airport and answering some basic questions. The location was fine, between two metro lines. Safe feeling neighborhood, with lots of little shops and dining close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good hotel excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MarinersTours
Reviews.Content: We stayed he for 2 nights over a weekend we went with friend so had 2 rooms one on the ground floor and one on the 4th floor. Both were of a good standard quite modern and very clean. The bathrooms were of a good size and had a selection of toiletries. No kettle but coffee was available in reception. Beds were comfortable. The best part of the hotel was the breakfast which was included in our price, the breakfast room is quite small but we never had problem getting a table. Good selection of normal breakfast fair, but of a good standard and very plentiful. We found the hotel staff to be really helpful with any of our questions. The location is really good there are 2 areas full of restaurants within an easy walking distance of the hotel that offer fixed price menus. We ate well both nights. It’s in a good location easy walking distance to Notre Dam, and the Pantheon as well as Metro stops on the door way. We found the metro system to be a bit confusing but got there in the end. This hotel is really great value, for Paris and has a really good breakfast. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: sbritton3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family in 2004. Wife and I in one room with double bed. 2 teenage children in next door room with 2 twin beds. Each room had its own bathroom, with small balcony and view of Notre Dame Cathedral. Across the street and around the corner is the ancient Roman "Arena of Lutece". Two blocks to Metro station Monge, banks nearby with international ATM, and easy walk within Latin Quarter and Norte Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience and inexpensive!!”
Reviews.Author: joecummin
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel within 2 blocks of 3 Metro stops but within walking distance of most sight-seeing destinations. Cafes and shops also very convenient . The staff was extremely helpful and willing to help with any questions I had. The hotel was approx. 500 meters from Notre Dame and other sights. I usually would walk to most sights and only use Metro for more distant visits. I bought a carnet of Metro tickets but only used 5 because of proximity to all sights. Will definitely stay here on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfy”
Reviews.Author: Tal K
Reviews.Content: A French colleague booked this hotel for me. The hotel is small, and the rooms are really tiny. However. the room I had (room #1) was very comfortable, as the closet and dressers had much space for my clothes. In addition there was a small desk over there, which was comfortable for working on my computer. The room and bath were very clean, but there was not shower curtain there. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice and the location of this hotel is just fabulous. Wireless internet connection is reasonably priced and surprisingly fast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horiible!”
Reviews.Author: NYCshoegirl
Reviews.Content: This was a huge disappointment and a waste of much money. We booked this so called 3 star hotel online and was excited because of it's location in the Latin Quarter. The worst part was that we booked this hotel for 10 nights. This is not a 3 star hotel. I would give it only one star because of the location and two very nice employess, Anthony and Hugh. This particular trip was very important to us, we were celebrating our one year anniversary together and what do you know my boyfriend, now fiancee proposed to me at the Luxembourg gardens. The hotel ruined everything for us! You cant feel romantic in a hotel that is depressing to stay in. It was truly not a 3 star rating. The rooms were severely small, with the full size bed taking up the whole area. The stinch of the room was very old and extremely difficult to relax in. The bed was old and the mattress was stained and shredding. I chose to lay blankets on the floor and sleep there instead of the bed. It is very sad that I have to sleep on the floor with the obscene amount of money paid for this hotel stay. The bathroom was clean, however there is no shower curtain with a hand held shower, so water was all over the floor. We were both furious, but had to stay because of the no refund policy. We purposely stayed out all day and night just so we didnt have to spend time there. The only positive comment we have about this hotel is the professionalism we received from anthony and hugh. They both were very nice and helpful. Huge disappointment and waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cunole
Reviews.Content: The location was good, but the room wasn't terribly clean and the air conditioning didn't work. Even though the weather wasn't terribly warm it was still stifling in the room and made it feel even smaller than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ipopcorn2
Reviews.Content: My 20 yr old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for one week. The room was very small but we expected that from the reviews we read on this sight. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the street which was fine for us. Rue Monge is a busy street, and the hotel is between two metro stops within a 5 minute walk. The only problem we encountered was the hotel didn't have the key to the room safe. The people before us left with it. We put are valuables out of sight and had no problem. The room was very clean, and the bathroom spotless, probably because when you took a shower the whole room got washed, as there is no shower curtain. We also ate breakfast at the hotel, which was very good. They offer a selection of fruit, yogurt, sausage, bacon,eggs,cereal, juice. The price of breakfast was included in our package. The staff was helpful in giving directions, making reservations, etc. My daughter is working in Paris for the month of June, living in a dorm, and Valerie at the front desk gave her the business card for the hotel and told her to call if she had any problems. We bought water, soda, etc at the market down the street. The price at the hotel for a bottle of water/soda is outragous. RueMoffetard, located behind the hotel is a great street filled with small, inexpensive cafes and shops. We ate there several times. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. Overall, this hotel is what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 2 !! EATEN ALIVE BY BED BUGS.”
Reviews.Author: BananaBucks
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed for one night this week and were allocated rooms 1 and 2 - in the dark courtyard. The man on reception was very pleasant and we did not stay long in the room and as we were only there for one night the room was adequate. The bathroom was clean. I had no complaints..... until.......I discovered on my return journey home the following day that I had been bitten alive by BED BUGS!!!! I have huge itchy welts all over my body. YUK!!! The hotel is in a good location but I am not sure I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not very charmant”
Reviews.Author: LondonOpenminded
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels like this a treading a very fine line between being charmant and plain unacceptable. Small rooms, thin walls, shabby chic public areas are all kind of OK if one is not paying too much, but this is 180 euros a night if one walks of the streets. The des Nations is no better or worse than other Parisian hotels in this respect, but in most cities one would avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Only good things to say about Des Nations”
Reviews.Author: jenji
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days in Paris, and we stayed at Des Nations St Germain. I have only positive things to say about this hotel. We were put in a top floor room (6th floor) and the view was fabulous. On a clear day, we could see Notre Dame and Sacre Couer. I am very sensitive to noise, and I don't recall hearing much of anything in terms of street noise. Sure, the occasional police sirens would go by, but that just added to the ambiance of being in Paris! As others have said, the lift is tiny, but it wasn't a big deal. We didn't eat the breakfast that the hotel offered, as it was more economical to grab something on the go from one of the countless bakeries around the hotel. Rue Mouffetard was a quick 5-min walk and we spent most evenings there enjoying the countless Prix Fixe menus offered. The hotel staff was always friendly when we came and went. Never had any problems, or rudeness. A few times the heat in our room went out, but a staff member was there in less than 5 mins to reset some switch in the hall and that solved the problem. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, it's decent priced and only 15 mins from the River and Notre Dame. The neighborhood is wonderful, a true Parisien-neighborhood with all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “My money was stolen from my hotel room here!”
Reviews.Author: YorkAthena80
Reviews.Content: When you leave the hotel you have to leave your room key with the front desk for "security purposes", but then oddly on the hotel room door there is a big sign that says "management is not responsible for stolen articles in room"-- I was very stupid to trust that no one would come in my room one early eve while I was away for about 2 hours and yes, I should have used the safe, so it was totally my fault. But just to warn you that someone entered my room that knew I was gone and stole $300.00 from me!! An employee at the front desk couldn't have cared less or have been any less helpful. It was not a good experience. Overall if you leave out the fact that there was someone in my room that shouldn't have been there, the rooms were pretty small and cramped. Cleanliness was also a problem as I found numerous pubic hairs in my bed sheets and bathroom on arrival-- Location was good though-- but maybe look elsewhere if you can as it was all a bit dodgy!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommnded”
Reviews.Author: celt32girl
Reviews.Content: A great find! As mentioned previously the location is excellent - very handy for the Metro, close to loads of restaurants and a shortish walk to Notre Dame. The staff were all very nice & extremely helpful. Room size was fine - enough (just) to put cases down but no use if you were planning to have a disco in there... The bathroom was absolutely spotless & was bigger than expected but - without a shower curtain - destined to become VERY slippy. (There was a bath mat provided). Only issue was that a cleaner used one of my carrier bags to empty the bin - & then left it in the room anyway.. This did not detract from a great stay - the reception staff really were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful time, Great location”
Reviews.Author: domer00lewis
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is in a great little neigborhood with the famous Rue Moufettard a block away. The rooms are small but quaint and very clean. The room we stayed in had 3 balconies, not usual but very appreciated. Most have at least one balcony, I believe. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. We requested rooms with bathtubs and it was awesome to soak in a tub after many miles pounding the pavement of Paris all day. It is a fifteen minute walk from the hotel to Notre Dame Cathedral and there are so many cafes and shops near there. I think it is so important to stay in Paris in the center of everything. Your rooms are smaller but everything is right outside. Every morning we would go and buy french bread from the bakery right down the street and then we would walk to our destinations and take buses and metro for places further away. There are two metro stops very close Place Monge and Cardinal Lemoine. I heartily recommend this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: KP32
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on Monday 7th Jan for one night. The room was great! Very clean and although small (but that's hotels in paris for you) the bathroom was very clean and had good hot water. It was located in a very central area, which was great because we were only there for one night. The desk was serviced by very nice and very good english speaking people. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Pankannie
Reviews.Content: We arrived after driving down from Calais - we found the hotel easily, but were very disappointed on arrival. The hotel staff were very nice, but our room at on the top (6th) floor which faced the front was miniscule and not very clean. There were pubic hairs on the bathroom floor, no shower curtain (in a typical 3ft long french bath which my boyfriend wouldn't be able to bathe in) - the only good thing about the bathroom was the towels (nice and white and fluffy). We had a balcony looking to the front - but the doors wouldn't open (but this was soon sorted out by the hotel staff). For the price that we paid, we didn't feel that it any way warranted the 3 stars that it had been awarded - 1.5 if that. Some other comments include: 1 tiny pillow each, no ironing board in the room, TV remote control didn't work and the buttons on the aging TV didn't work very easily. Noisy maids in the morning who kept walking in time and time again. However, as the other reviews have said, the location is fabulous, with the stagger back after welcoming in the new year outside Notre Dame very easy! So if you are planning on going to Paris, try and stay in the same area as this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As Most Have said..........”
Reviews.Author: Yourow
Reviews.Content: As most people have said, the location is excellent. I found walking through some of the surrounding streets excellent. There were also a great variety of shops close by including a supermarket, internet Cafe (Both winin a 2 minute walk). Notre Dam ia about a 10 min walk. Getting around Paris from the hotel was extremely easy via train or bus. We stayed on the 2nd floor with a room facing the street. It wasn't as noisy as I would have thought and we were able to sleep without a problem. The rooms are quite small, but bottom line is they were clean. The bed and pillows were comfortable in comparison to others I experienced on my trip around Europe. Bathroom was small but relatively new and very clean. I suppose you wouldn't want to be a large person in this hotel. All staff were extremely helpful and polite. When I return I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SCS62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 07 and as with other reviewers found the staff friendly & helpful and the location ideal for exploring Paris due to its proximity to the Metro and easy 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame and the hop on/off bus route. On checking in we asked for a room with a balcony and were given a room on the top floor facing the back of the hotel. It did have 2 balconies but also unfortunately had a terrible smell that we suspect was caused by dampness resulting from leaking hand basin plumbing. Obviously we asked for an alternative room and were promptly given a mid-level room facing the front. This room was clean, neat and tidy but unfortunately so small that we had to step over our bags to navigate around - certainly not the place for anyone with 2 or more bags! In summary - if you are looking for a good value hotel in a good location this is well worth considering but remember to pack light!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Voyager46
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a week in Paris visiting his daughter who was studying there, and we shared a room at the Hotel des Nations. Although we asked for twin beds, you could hardly get a razor blade between them. Needless to say, the room was tiny, more on the order of a broom closet or a shoe closet than a regular closet. On the other hand, the breakfast was good and plentiful, and the staff was friendly and helpful. There was a laundromat across the street - a real boon for those who don't like wearing dirty clothes or packing weeks' worth of underwear. The location was great - other revfiewers have remarked on the proximity to the plentiful and the very reasonable for Paris restaurants on the Rue Moufetard, which is a real asset. Overall, quite a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fab views”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Darren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three days recently and found the room to be spotless, the staff friendly and helpful (the restaurant they recommended nearby was great) and the location excellent for getting to all the sights, inc. Notre Dame a 5 minute walk away. The best part of our stay was being on the 6th floor which offered a wonderful over the rooftops to Notre Dame. Some reviews have said the rooms are too small but how much space do you need inside your room when all of Paris is on your doorstep? We'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: talaria0
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3-night stay at this hotel after choosing it based upon the reviews on the site and its cental location in the Latin Quarter. First, the hotel is at a great location accessible by various Metro stops. This helps a great deal when you have many places to see in Paris in a very short amount of time. We found the room and bathroom to be small (as expected) but definitely sufficient, clean, bright, and surprisingly quiet considering we had a 3rd floor room facing the street. The room had a full private bath with a small shower stall with a door. (Girls, don't expect to shave your legs comfortably in this). Bring washrags if you use them, but typical hotel toiletries and towels were provided. There is a safe in the room that requires a 30 Euro deposit to get the key. It worked out well. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke English well. Not only did the receptionist make sightseeing recommendations and provided maps upon check-in, but the staff also helped with a medical emergency which involved placing many late-night phone calls, calling in a doctor, and recommending pharmacies and stores that were open late at night. (Thanks, Julian!!) This hotel definitely caters to English speaking tourists and has the feel of an urban hotel (e.g. no bidet). Overall, staying here was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Glad wec booked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bill1215
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay based on the positive reviews on this site and we were not disappointed.The rooms may be small, but they are very clean and comfortable. The hotel charges 12 euros for a buffet breakfast, which may seem a bit steep, but when you compare this with what cafes round about were charging it is fairly reasonable. The hotel is situated between two metro stations which are on differemt lines and is a ten/fifteen walk from Notre Dam. There is a good choice of restaurants nearby, would recommend Symposium. The Des Nations is a good base for seeing the sights. It is situated in a fairly quiet area and you felt safe walking about at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lyn01
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 2 nights at the end of May after reading the reviews on this site. We were in a room on the 5th floor, and found everything that has already been written to be true. Its very friendly and English speaking, the bathroom was spotless and a good size, and although the bedroom wasnt huge, it was fine for a couple of nights. The location is excellent - safe and very handy for the Metro and local restaurants. We never heard any noise from other rooms or traffic (though that might have been because we were so high up!) Lovely cotton sheets as well.

Reviews.Title: “As if Paris could be even better, this hotel did it.”
Reviews.Author: misselaine
Reviews.Content: I can imagine it would be a little difficult to manage in the small rooms if you have a lot of luggage, but if you have a normal amount...This hotel was absolutley wonderful. Very friendly and extremely helpful staff, clean rooms, very nice bathroom, wonderful view and it is in a FANTASTIC area. I would definately stay here again, and again, and again...

Reviews.Title: “The price makes it good”
Reviews.Author: Marcus2000
Reviews.Content: Location was great. About 5mins from the metro. Room was small, but clean. They obviously dont do shower curtains, so the extra towels were perfect for moppin up the floor!! Breakfast included eggs and bacon. Lift was dodgy, but sure it gets you there in the end! Staff were grand. I'd recoommend it for those looking for a bargain in an expensive city. 100euro for a twin including breakfast - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: TKDJ
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews pretty accurate. We survived 5 nights in our tiny room at the Des Nations. Once we got over the initial shock at the size of our room (nothing like the hotel photos on website!) we had a good stay. I wouldn't liek to stay there with somebody i didn't wish to be fairly intimate with though - not much privacy! The hotel is clean, a bit noisy, friendly but most of all in an excellent location. Rue Mouffetard was wonderful and really not very touristy with a great choice of places to eat and drink. easy access to the rest of Paris from Place Monge metro stop. I would definiatly vist this area again but would probably go for a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: EnricoJyess
Reviews.Content: The reviews are honest and therefore there were no surprises. Decor comfy, rooms small but entirely functional and it does what is says on the tin. Staff very friendly, location terrific and viewing over the balcony good fun. Eateries, Patisseries and everything on the doorstep. We booked via ---.com and got a great rate and for the money we were VERY pleased. Go on, give it a go. The Marriott it is not but with English and foreign newspapers, comfy bed and heating/AC, what more can you want. We would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: helencaswell
Reviews.Content: We had a room on 5th floor and could look out our windows to the street. Clean, pleasant, basic place. Like another reviewer here, I would suggest this hotel for staying one night. It was claustrophobic. And being from San Francisco, I'm use to small spaces. There's also a disclaimer on your door saying the hotel isn't responsible for anything you leave in the room. Then you have to give them your key? Even though I speak some French, the first desk man we encountered was very condescending. The other 4 people we interacted with over the week at the front desk were nice. The inexpensive airport shuttle to CDG arrived 40 minutes late and we almost missed our flight home. So book that very early or take a cab. Someone connected with the hotel confided that you can find cheaper places with bigger rooms. This is a 2 Star Hotel- bare bones. If I ever go back, I will stay in St. Germain de Pres instead of this outer area of Latin Quarter and would try to see more shows at night. Favorite things in Paris- Musee Picasso, Le Pompidou, Musee D'Orsay, parks and gardens, Le Marais, Rue Mouffetard, seeing the Eiffel Tower after 11pm for the lights, hats and shoes, bicycles, the petit coffee, les eclaires.... bon appetit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent problem solving”
Reviews.Author: chesterimp
Reviews.Content: If a hotel is to be judged by how it rectifies problems, this comes close to full marks. Booked 4 nights for family for a half-term 'Eurostar' break, settled on the Latin Quarter and this hotel based on other TA reviews. Arrived early evening, very pleasant (English speaking) young man on front desk booked us into two rooms on 3rd floor. These were small but clean (as expected) one twin and one double (we'd asked for 2 adjacent twins, don't think there were any). Were just settling in when the bath in the twin room started making noises, water bubbled up from the plughole accompanied by the inevitable smell. French plumbing, zut alors!Summoned the young man, who nearly fainted with the smell. After initially agreeing to relocate that room to the 5th floor and splitting us, he reappeared a short time later to offer two adjacent rooms on the 6th (top) floor - these were bigger and a better standard, and would be provided with breakfast the following day, at no extra charge. Front (twin) room was terrific - 3 balconies (one in the bathroom) with view of Notre Dame & Sacre Coeur. Bathroom was tight, anyone of 'above average' girth wouldn't be able to get into shower cubicle. Rear (double) room wasn't as good, view over back courtyard. Staff were all friendly and spoke English, enjoyed our bad French, predictably the 'free breakfast' hadn't been recorded, different receptionist and took a few moments to resolve when checking out. Good location, Rue Monge is busy, but not distractingly so, with good metro & bus services - we used the buses, you see more! As others have said, breakfast is expensive (although we enjoyed the free one), there are much better deals nearby. Wide selection of restaurants, boulangeries, etc in the area, well worth going up to Rue Mouffletard & 'Place de Cantaloupes' (its not called that, can't remember the name but sounds like....) to the rear of the hotel, to eat/drink/watch Parisians. All in all, a good, clean hotel at the price, in a terrific location. It is worth paying more for the top floor rooms if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: WereWifeinLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Des Nations for our one year anniversary. We found the desk staff to be friendly and helpful for the most part. The location was perfect- Rue Mouffetard is only a block away and is perfect for getting a drink or lovely French food, and the entire city is easily accessible by foot- we didn't take the Metro once during our stay. The shower was small but standard for an European hotel room. The towels were clean as was the bathroom and room. We didn't eat the buffet but rather would wander over to Rue Mouffetard and walk into town with a panini. My only real problem with the hotel was the incredibly small walls- we were directly next to the lift, which wasn't too loud when it was running, but at night when people were coming back to their rooms we would hear the doors open and close and people would slam their doors. We also seemed to have the head of our bed directly next to the toilet in the next room- the guy one room over seems to have had a lot to drink before he came back to the hotel- ewww. Otherwise it was quite pleasant and despite the noise at night I would stay there again due to the amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Des Nations”
Reviews.Author: LOUISE1HAWTHORN
Reviews.Content: The review submitted previously was spot on regards the pleasing stay at Des Nations.We had room 46 which had lovely french windows with the view of a walled garden. The Latin quarter is such a great place to stay. Turn right out of the hotel , then 2nd on the right and the road takes you to Place Contrascape. Great cafes open until 2.00am, loads of restauraunts, and the fantastic market on Rue Mouffletard especially on a Sunday morning. With a man playing the accordian, sitting sipping a cafe au lait, we could have been in the film Amelie!! (In fact , a scene in the film is filmed in a little bar on Mouffeltard) Back to the hotel, very clean, slightly disappoined that we didn't have a bath in the bathroom. Bit of advice, it is far cheaper to book a taxi to the airport rather than using the hotel taxi shuttle, or just grab a cab outside the airport on arriving ( 20 euros from Orly including a tip)And as far as the hotel breakfast goes, all looked very pleasant but with the gastronomic capital of the world on your door step, head down any street for breakfast and you'll get a better choice and price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: wengen05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a cheap and cheerful hotel in the latin quarter for 1 night. We found Des Nations online and after looking at these reviews booked it £98 for double room B&B was cheap but not luxury - the bath had no plug (we were given one when asked) and there was no shower curtain - the room was very small (Like all paris hotels) - we were in the courtyard at the back room 4 - the metro trains could be heard underneath our room and it smelt very damp. Cheap and cheerful but dont think we will be rushing back here. Pretty basic but ideal for a night whilst passing through the magnificent city of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: finaghy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good prices through Expedia. Easy to find as metro stop right opposite the hotel. Convenient location for Latin Quarter and Notre Dame. Rooms small but that is normal in Paris! Modern and tidy decor in rooms, all very clean. Reception helpful. Don't buy breakfast at the hotel as it is expensive - instead walk down the road to any number of local cafes. Book in advance as gets full quickly!

Reviews.Title: “great location! very clean!! highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLERYEY
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on the 31st of july 2006 for a week. it was a central location only a 10 min walk from the river where notra dame! there is 2 safe undergrounds one at either side of the hotel! and a great bakery next to both for breakfast as the breakfast is expensive in the hotel n the croissiants from the bakery are gorgeous!! the rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels everyday! the staff were really friendly - you have to leave your key with them everytime you leave! but we had no problems with this. the room was a little small but it was perfect for what we needed it for as when your in paris there is too much to see and do to spend time in the room!! there is also alot of storage in the rooms!! i would recommended ne tourist to this hotel it was a safe, friednly, clean and in a great location! the area is very quiet and we saw no trouble at all! hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bushytailedfox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in July and found it to be a good little hotel for the price. The location is good - you have the choice of two metro lines both within a couple of minutes walk (Rue Monge metro means only 1 change if you are coming on the RER from Charles de Gaulle airport). We arrived at 11 assuming our room would not be ready but wanting to leave our bags. The receptionist couldn't have been more helpful until it transpired that he had no record of our booking, then his attitude changed - which I think is a French thing rather than a thing personal to him. We gave him our booking reference and showed him the paperwork and left it to him to sort whilst we went out. We returned at around 4, and it transpired that laterooms apparently hadn't faxed through the initial booking, hence the initial confusion. He had accommodated our request to be on the 5th floor in a twin room, the only problem being that they had only just started cleaning it! I am assuming this was because he had to shuffle things around and this took time, as on the Sunday we came back at around the same time and the room was spotless. The room was very small (as you would expect in a 3* Parisian hotel), but very nicely furnished and done in such a way as to give plenty of storage. Large bathroom (no shower curtain on the bath, which would have been helpful as we didn't have a separate shower). Considering there were 2 of us with a case each, we didn't have any problems moving about the place. The air con was a blessing, and we had no issues with noise or anything else. The picture you see on the internet of the room looking large was not the room we were in, so I would assume you would have to be upgraded to get it - so don't expect a large, spacious room and you won't be disappointed! We had breakfast at a lovely cafe - Cafe Delmas on Rue Mouffetard, the whole of this area was lovely so can't comment on food at the hotel, but excellent location within easy walk of the Notre Dame, Pantheon, Jardins des Luxembourg and many more - woudl recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel des Nations St-Germain
HotelInfo.Address: 54 rue Monge, 75005 Paris, France
